result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Lomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by August 5, 2015; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Lomas

defendant.name: Lomas, Anthony James
defendant.address: W221 N 2767 Hickorywood Court, Waukesha, WI 53186

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order granting payment plan of $50.00/month beginning 10/1/2015.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan received and filed.
ADMINISTRATIVE STAY ALLOWING DEFENDANT UNTIL     09/05/2015     TO PAY FINE AND COSTS, GRANTED.

Defendant Anthony James Lomas in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.    Court found defendant guilty ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Court ordered defendant serve 3 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 3 DAYS time served. 
 Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.  
Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by August 5, 2015; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Anthony James Lomas in court with attorney Michael Jude who appears as a friend of the court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case scheduled for bail/bond hearing on State's motion.  Defense counsel is not familiar with this case and is not comfortable arguing bail on the defendant's behalf.  Attorney Francisco Araiza is appointed counsel on this matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered absolute sobriety during the pendency of this case.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony James Lomas in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-9-2015 at 1:30pm
